Dale Earnhardt, Jr..label: Dale Earnhardt, Jr.
Dale Earnhardt, Jr..description: Ralph Dale Earnhardt, Jr. is an American stock car racing driver and team owner. He is the son of NASCAR Hall of Famer Dale Earnhardt, Sr. He is also the grandson of both NASCAR driver Ralph Earnhardt ... Wikipedia
Dale Earnhardt, Jr..Born: October 10, 1974 (age 39), Kannapolis, North Carolina, United States

Coo Coo Marlin.label: Coo Coo Marlin
Coo Coo Marlin.description: Clifton "Coo Coo" Marlin was a NASCAR Winston Cup driver who spent 14 years in the series. Wikipedia

Danica Patrick.label: Danica Patrick
Danica Patrick.description: Danica Sue Patrick is an American auto racing driver, model and advertising spokeswoman. She is the most successful woman in the history of American open-wheel racing—her win in the 2008 Indy Japan ... Wikipedia

Dario Franchitti.label: Dario Franchitti
Dario Franchitti.description: George Dario Marino Franchitti is a British racing driver from Scotland. Now retired, he won the IndyCar Series four times; in 2007, and three titles consecutively between 2009 and 2011. Wikipedia

Juan Pablo Montoya.label: Juan Pablo Montoya
Juan Pablo Montoya.description: Juan Pablo Montoya Roldán is a Colombian racing driver known internationally for being one of the few drivers participating in NASCAR, Formula One, CART and IndyCar race competitions. Wikipedia
Awards: Laureus World Sports Award for Breakthrough of the Year

LeeRoy Yarbrough.label: LeeRoy Yarbrough
LeeRoy Yarbrough.description: Lonnie "LeeRoy" Yarbrough was a NASCAR racer. His best season was 1969 when he won seven races, tallied 21 finishes in the top-ten and earned $193,211. Wikipedia

Max Papis.label: Max Papis
Max Papis.description: Massimiliano "Max" Papis is a racing driver who has competed in several top-level motorsports events such as Le Mans 24 Hours, Formula One and Champ Car. He has three Champ Car victories. He is the son-in-law of Emerson Fittipaldi. Wikipedia

Patty Moise.label: Patty Moise
Patty Moise.description: Patty Moise is a former NASCAR driver. She drove in five Winston Cup races from 1987 to 1989, and 133 Busch Series races from 1986 to 1998. She is the wife of former fellow NASCAR driver Elton Sawyer. Wikipedia

Adam Petty.label: Adam Petty
Adam Petty.description: Adam Kyler Petty was a professional racing driver. He was the first fourth-generation driver in NASCAR history. Wikipedia
Adam Petty.Born: July 10, 1980, Trenton, New Jersey, United States
Adam Petty.Died: May 12, 2000, Loudon, New Hampshire, United States

Ricky Craven.label: Ricky Craven
Ricky Craven.description: Richard Allen Craven is an ESPN broadcaster who works ESPN2's NASCAR Now and a race analyst for the network. Prior to his ESPN duties, he was a NASCAR driver who won in four different series—the K&N Pro Series, and the three national series. Wikipedia

Benny Parsons.label: Benny Parsons
Benny Parsons.description: Benjamin Stewart Parsons was an American NASCAR driver, and later an announcer/analyst/pit reporter on SETN, TBS, ABC, ESPN, NBC and TNT. He became famous as the 1973 NASCAR Winston Cup champion. Wikipedia
Benny Parsons.Born: July 12, 1941, Wilkes County, North Carolina, United States
Benny Parsons.Died: January 16, 2007, Charlotte, North Carolina, United States

Wally Dallenbach, Jr..label: Wally Dallenbach, Jr.
Wally Dallenbach, Jr..description: Wally Dallenbach, Jr. is an American racecar driver who formerly competed in the NASCAR Winston Cup Series. He competed in 226 Winston Cup races from 1991 to 2001 and had 23 top 10 finishes. Wikipedia

Troy Ruttman.label: Troy Ruttman
Troy Ruttman.description:
Troy Ruttman was an American race car driver. He was the older brother of NASCAR driver Joe Ruttman.
Ruttman won the Indianapolis 500 in 1952, at the age of 22 years and 80 days. As of 2012, he is the youngest winner of the race. Wikipedia
Troy Ruttman.Died: May 19, 1997, Lake Havasu City, Arizona, United States

Tayler Malsam.label: Tayler Malsam
Tayler Malsam.description: Tayler Malsam is an American stock car racing driver. He has competed in the NASCAR Nationwide Series and Camping World Truck Series. Wikipedia

Bob Flock.label: Bob Flock
Bob Flock.description: Robert Newman Flock of Fort Payne, Alabama, USA was an early NASCAR driver. He qualified on the pole position for NASCAR's first Strictly Stock race and, along with Red Byron, is considered one of the two best drivers from that era. Wikipedia
Bob Flock.Born: April 16, 1918, Fort Payne, Alabama, United States

Bill Amick.label: Bill Amick
Bill Amick.description: Bill Amick was a NASCAR Grand National and West Coast driver from Portland, Oregon. He has one win, nineteen top-fives, twenty-seven top 10s, and five poles in Grand National. Wikipedia

Boris Said.label: Boris Said
Boris Said.description: Boris Said III is an American race car driver from Carlsbad, California but considers his hometown to be Stamford, Connecticut and was born in New York City. Wikipedia
Boris Said.Born: September 18, 1962 (age 51), New York City, New York, United States

Bobby Hamilton, Jr..label: Bobby Hamilton, Jr.
Bobby Hamilton, Jr..description: Charles Robert "Bobby" Hamilton, Jr. is a American stock car racing driver. He formerly competed in the NASCAR Nextel Cup Series and Busch Series. Wikipedia

Bryan Clauson.label: Bryan Clauson
Bryan Clauson.description: Bryan Clauson, is an American auto racing driver. He attended Noblesville High School in Noblesville, Indiana. Wikipedia

Carl Long.label: Carl Long
Carl Long.description: James Carlyle "Carl" Long is a NASCAR race car driver and mechanic who is currently driving the #15 Ford Mustang for Rick Ware Racing in the Nationwide Series. Wikipedia
Carl Long.Born: September 20, 1967 (age 46), Roxboro, North Carolina, United States

Buck Baker.label: Buck Baker
Buck Baker.description: Elzie Wylie Baker Sr., better known as Buck Baker, was an American racing driver. Born in Richburg, South Carolina, Baker began his NASCAR career in 1949 and won his first race three years later at Columbia Speedway. Wikipedia
Buck Baker.Born: March 4, 1919, Richburg, South Carolina, United States
Buck Baker.Died: April 14, 2002, Charlotte, North Carolina, United States

Casey Mears.label: Casey Mears
Casey Mears.description: Casey James Mears is an American stock car and open-wheel racing driver. A competitor in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series, he currently drives the No. 13 Chevrolet SS for Germain Racing. Wikipedia

Claude Ballot-Léna.label: Claude Ballot-Léna
Claude Ballot-Léna.description: Claude Ballot-Léna was a French race driver born in Paris. Wikipedia

Chad Little.label: Chad Little
Chad Little.description: Chad Little is a former NASCAR driver. He holds a degree in marketing from Washington State University, and a law degree from Gonzaga University. While attending Washington State University he joined the Delta Upsilon Fraternity. Wikipedia

Colin Braun.label: Colin Braun
Colin Braun.description: Colin Braun is an American racing driver. He will compete in the American Le Mans Series with the Core Autosport team during the 2012 season. He formerly competed in the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series and the Nationwide Series. Wikipedia

Dan Clarke.label: Dan Clarke
Dan Clarke.description: Dan Clarke is a British auto racing driver born 4 October 1983 in Mexborough, most recently competing in the Firestone Indy Lights series with Walker Racing, having previously competed in the A1GP World ... Wikipedia

David Pearson (racing driver).label: David Pearson
David Pearson (racing driver).description: David Gene Pearson is a former American stock car racer from Spartanburg, South Carolina. Pearson began his NASCAR career in 1960 and ended his first season by winning the 1960 NASCAR Rookie of the Year award. Wikipedia
David Pearson (racing driver).Born: December 22, 1934 (age 79), Spartanburg, South Carolina, United States

Donny Lia.label: Donny Lia
Donny Lia.description: Donny Lia is an American race car driver. He won the 2007 & 2009 NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour championship. He also won the Race of Champions Modified Tour races in 2004, 2005, 2006, and 2007. Wikipedia
Donny Lia.Born: November 8, 1978 (age 35), Jericho, New York, United States

Dorsey Schroeder.label: Dorsey Schroeder
Dorsey Schroeder.description: Dorsey Schroeder is a race car driver born February 5, 1953 in Kirkwood, Missouri. Dorsey currently lives in Florida with his wife Kim and daughter Carissa Schroeder from his second marriage. Wikipedia

Earl Ross.label: Earl Ross
Earl Ross.description: Earl Ross is a Canadian race car driver who competed in the NASCAR Winston Cup Series from 1973 to 1976 driving the Carling Red Cap #52. Wikipedia

Frank Warren (racing driver).label: Frank Warren
Frank Warren (racing driver).description: Frank Warren is a retired NASCAR Winston Cup Series driver who raced from 1963 to 1980. Wikipedia

Gary Bettenhausen.label: Gary Bettenhausen
Gary Bettenhausen.description: Gary Bettenhausen was an American auto racing driver. He was born in Blue Island, Illinois, raised in Tinley Park, Illinois, graduated in the class of 1962 from Bremen High School in Midlothian, Illinois ... Wikipedia
Gary Bettenhausen.Born: November 18, 1941, Tinley Park, Illinois, United States

Greg Biffle.label: Greg Biffle
Greg Biffle.description: Gregory Jack "Greg" Biffle is a NASCAR driver who drives the No. 16 Ford Fusion for Roush Fenway Racing in the Sprint Cup Series. Wikipedia

Harry Gant.label: Harry Gant
Harry Gant.description: Harry Phil Gant, better known as Handsome Harry, is a retired American racecar driver best known for driving the #33 Skoal Bandit car on the NASCAR Winston Cup circuit during the 1980s and 1990s. Wikipedia
Harry Gant.Born: January 10, 1940 (age 74), Taylorsville, North Carolina, United States

Janet Guthrie.label: Janet Guthrie
Janet Guthrie.description: Janet Guthrie is a retired professional race car driver and the first woman to qualify and compete in both the Indianapolis 500 and the Daytona 500. Wikipedia
Janet Guthrie.Born: March 7, 1938 (age 76), Iowa City, Iowa, United States

Jeff Andretti.label: Jeff Andretti
Jeff Andretti.description: Jeff Andretti is a former American race car driver. He competed in CART, and was the series' Rookie of the Year in 1991. Wikipedia

Jeremy Mayfield.label: Jeremy Mayfield
Jeremy Mayfield.description: Jeremy Allen Mayfield is a former NASCAR driver who last competed in 2009 due to legal troubles and an indefinite suspension by NASCAR. Wikipedia
Awards: Kentucky Motor Speedway Rookie of the Year
Auto Racing Club Rookie of the Year

Jerry Cook.label: Jerry Cook
Jerry Cook.description: Jerry Cook is a NASCAR modified championship race car driver. He began racing at the age of 13 and won the track championship at Utica-Rome Speedway in 1969. Wikipedia
Jerry Cook.Born: July 31, 1945 (age 68), Rome, New York, United States

John Andretti.label: John Andretti
John Andretti.description: John Andretti is an American race car driver. He has won in CART, IMSA GTP, Rolex Sports Car Series, and NASCAR. He was the last NASCAR driver to win a Cup race for the Petty Enterprises team, which folded in 2008. Wikipedia

John King (racing driver).label: John King
John King (racing driver).description: John King II is an American stock car racing driver. He currently competes part-time in the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series. Wikipedia

Johnny Rutherford.label: Johnny Rutherford
Johnny Rutherford.description: John Sherman Rutherford III, better known as Johnny Rutherford, and also known as "Lone Star JR" is a former U.S. automobile racer known for being one of nine drivers to win the prestigious Indianapolis 500 mile race at least three times. Wikipedia

Josh Wise.label: Josh Wise
Josh Wise.description: Josh Wise is an American stock car driver. He currently competes in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series, driving the No. 98 Chevrolet SS for Phil Parsons Racing. Wikipedia

Kasey Kahne.label: Kasey Kahne
Kasey Kahne.description: Kasey Kenneth Kahne is a NASCAR driver. He drives the No. 5 Farmers Insurance Group/Quaker State Chevrolet SS for Hendrick Motorsports in the Sprint Cup Series. Wikipedia

Bob Cooper (racing driver).label: Bob Cooper
Bob Cooper (racing driver).description: Bob Cooper is a retired driver that raced in the NASCAR Grand National Series from 1962 to 1969. Wikipedia
Bob Cooper (racing driver).Born: November 13, 1935 (age 78), Gastonia, North Carolina, United States

Kevin Grubb.label: Kevin Grubb
Kevin Grubb.description: Kevin Grubb was an American race car driver from Mechanicsville, Virginia. He was the younger brother of former race car driver Wayne Grubb. Wikipedia

Kurt Busch.label: Kurt Busch
Kurt Busch.description: Kurt Thomas Busch is an American stock car racing driver. He competes in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series, driving the No. 41 Haas Automation Chevrolet SS for Stewart-Haas Racing. Wikipedia
Kurt Busch.Born: August 4, 1978 (age 35), Las Vegas-Paradise, NV Metropolitan Statistical Area, Nevada, United States

Kyle Busch.label: Kyle Busch
Kyle Busch.description: Kyle Thomas Busch is an American stock car racing driver and team owner. He currently drives the No. 18 Toyota Camry in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series and the No. 54 Toyota Camry in the Nationwide Series for Joe Gibbs Racing. Wikipedia
Kyle Busch.Born: May 2, 1985 (age 28), Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

Kyle Petty.label: Kyle Petty
Kyle Petty.description: 'Kyle Eugene Petty is an American stock car racing driver. Now retired, he formerly competed in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series, and is currently a co-host for NASCAR RaceDay, which is on Fox Sports 1. He also commentates for TNT in the summer. Wikipedia
Kyle Petty.Born: June 2, 1960 (age 53), Level Cross, North Carolina, United States

Lake Speed.label: Lake Speed
Lake Speed.description: Lake Chambers Speed is a American stock car racintg driver. Now retired, he formerly competed in the NASCAR Winston Cup Series, scoring one career win in 402 starts. Wikipedia

Lee Petty.label: Lee Petty
Lee Petty.description: Lee Arnold Petty was an American stock car driver in the 1950s and 1960s. He was one of the pioneers of NASCAR, and one of its first superstars. Wikipedia
Lee Petty.Born: March 14, 1914, Randleman, North Carolina, United States
Lee Petty.Died: April 5, 2000, Greensboro, North Carolina, United States

Lloyd Dane.label: Lloyd Dane
Lloyd Dane.description: Lloyd Dane is a former NASCAR Grand National Series driver from Eldon, Missouri. He participated part time in the 1951 and 1954 to 1964 seasons, capturing 4 wins, all in his own car. Wikipedia

Matt Crafton.label: Matt Crafton
Matt Crafton.description: Matthew "Matt" Crafton is an American race car driver in the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series. He currently drives the No. 88 Menards Toyota Tundra for ThorSport Racing. Wikipedia

Matt Kenseth.label: Matt Kenseth
Matt Kenseth.description: Matthew Roy "Matt" Kenseth is an American professional stock car racing driver. He drives the No. 20 Toyota Camry for Joe Gibbs Racing in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series full-time as well as the No. 20 ... Wikipedia

Michael Ritch.label: Michael Ritch
Michael Ritch.description: Michael Ritch is an American stock car racing driver who competed in 47 races across NASCAR's top three series between 1992 and 2002. Wikipedia
Michael Ritch.Born: February 24, 1973 (age 41), High Point, North Carolina, United States

Mike Bliss.label: Mike Bliss
Mike Bliss.description: Michael "Mike" Bliss is an American stock car racing driver. A journeyman NASCAR competitor, he has run in all three major series. Bliss currently drives for TriStar Motorsports in the NASCAR Nationwide Series. Wikipedia

Mike Stefanik.label: Mike Stefanik
Mike Stefanik.description: Mike Stefanik is a NASCAR driver. He currently races in the Whelen Modified Tour, piloting the #22 Chevrolet. Stefanik was named the second greatest NASCAR Modified driver of all-time in 2003. Wikipedia

Ralph Earnhardt.label: Ralph Earnhardt
Ralph Earnhardt.description: Ralph Lee Earnhardt was a NASCAR driver. He was the father of Dale Earnhardt, Sr.; the grandfather of Dale Earnhardt, Jr., Kelly Earnhardt, Taylor Putnam, and Kerry Earnhardt, and great grandfather of Jeffrey Earnhardt and Bobby Dale Earnhardt. Wikipedia
Ralph Earnhardt.Born: February 23, 1928, Kannapolis, North Carolina, United States

Red Byron.label: Red Byron
Red Byron.description: Robert "Red" Byron was an American stock car racing driver, who was successful in NASCAR competition in the sanctioning body's first years. He was NASCAR's first Modified champion in 1948 and its first Strictly Stock champion in 1949. Wikipedia

Rex White.label: Rex White
Rex White.description: Rex White is a retired Irish auto racer and NASCAR champion. White was one of the drivers who competed for the original Ford racing team. He began racing in 1956, grabbing fourteen top-ten finishes. Wikipedia
Rex White.Born: August 17, 1929 (age 84), Taylorsville, North Carolina, United States

Richard Childress.label: Richard Childress
Richard Childress.description: Richard Childress is a former NASCAR driver and the current team owner of Richard Childress Racing. As a business entrepreneur, Childress became one of the wealthiest men in North Carolina. Wikipedia
Richard Childress.Born: September 21, 1945 (age 68), Winston-Salem, North Carolina, United States

Rick Mast.label: Rick Mast
Rick Mast.description: Rick Mast is a former NASCAR driver. He competed in both the Winston Cup and Busch Series before retiring in 2002. He holds a business administration degree from Blue Ridge Community College. Wikipedia
Rick Mast.Born: March 4, 1957 (age 57), Rockbridge Baths, Virginia, United States

Ricky Rudd.label: Ricky Rudd
Ricky Rudd.description: Richard L. "Ricky" Rudd, nicknamed "The Rooster," is a former American NASCAR driver. He is the uncle of actor Skeet Ulrich and former NASCAR Nationwide Series driver Jason Rudd. Wikipedia

Rob Moroso.label: Rob Moroso
Rob Moroso.description: Rob Moroso was a NASCAR racing driver who was champion of the NASCAR Busch Series in 1989, was posthumously awarded the 1990 NASCAR Winston Cup Rookie of the Year award. Wikipedia

Scot Walters.label: Scot Walters
Scot Walters.description: Scot Walters is an American stock car racer from Cornelius, North Carolina. He competed in NASCAR from 1997 to 1999 in the Camping World Truck Series, as well as one Nationwide Series race in 1998. Wikipedia
Scot Walters.Born: November 18, 1967 (age 46), Cornelius, North Carolina, United States

Scott Riggs.label: Scott Riggs
Scott Riggs.description: Russell Scott Riggs is an American stock car racing driver. He currently competes part-time in the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series and Camping World Truck Series. Wikipedia
Scott Riggs.Born: January 1, 1971 (age 43), Bahama, North Carolina, United States

Scott Gaylord.label: Scott Gaylord
Scott Gaylord.description: Scott Gaylord is an American race car driver. He has competed in four NASCAR Winston Cup Series races, all at Sears Point Raceway, most recently in 1996. He has been a long time competitor in the NASCAR Camping World West Series. Wikipedia

Scott Wimmer.label: Scott Wimmer
Scott Wimmer.description: Scott Wimmer is a NASCAR Nationwide Series driver. He drives for Wild Motorsports. He has a total of 6 wins in the Nationwide Series. His brother Chris Wimmer competed in the Busch Series. Wimmer co-owns State Park Speedway in Wausau, Wisconsin. Wikipedia

Shorty Rollins.label: Shorty Rollins
Shorty Rollins.description: Lloyd George "Shorty" Rollins, nicknamed "Shorty", born in Granbury, Texas was the first official NASCAR Rookie of the Year. Wikipedia

Tim Flock.label: Tim Flock
Tim Flock.description: Julius Timothy Flock was one of NASCAR's early pioneers, and a two-time series champion. He was a brother to NASCAR's second female driver Ethel Mobley and NASCAR pioneers Bob Flock and Fonty Flock. Wikipedia
Tim Flock.Born: May 11, 1924, Fort Payne, Alabama, United States

Tiny Lund.label: Tiny Lund
Tiny Lund.description: DeWayne Louis "Tiny" Lund was a NASCAR driver. He was ironically nicknamed "Tiny" due to his rather large and imposing size. Wikipedia

Trevor Bayne.label: Trevor Bayne
Trevor Bayne.description: Trevor Bayne is an American NASCAR Sprint Cup Series and Nationwide Series race car driver. He drives the No. 21 Ford Fusion for Wood Brothers Racing in the Sprint Cup Series part-time, and the No. 6 ... Wikipedia

Willy T. Ribbs.label: Willy T. Ribbs
Willy T. Ribbs.description: William "Willy" Theodore Ribbs, Jr. is a racecar driver who competed in many forms of auto racing. After retiring, he became a sport shooter in the National Sporting Clays Association. Wikipedia
Willy T. Ribbs.Born: January 3, 1955 (age 59), San Jose, California, United States

Angela Cope.label: Angela Cope
Angela Cope.description: Angela Christine Cope is a professional racing driver. She and her sister, Amber Cope, made NASCAR history on October 23, 2010 by being the first twins to compete in one of its top three series. Wikipedia

Bay Darnell.label: Bay Darnell
Bay Darnell.description: Bay Darnell is an American racing driver from Lake Bluff, Illinois. He raced mainly in USAC Stock Cars, but he did have a few Indy Car and NASCAR Grand National starts. His grandson Erik Darnell is a current NASCAR driver. Wikipedia
Bay Darnell.Born: February 4, 1931 (age 83), Lake Bluff, Illinois, United States

Bill Shirey.label: Bill Shirey
Bill Shirey.description: Bill Shirey is a retired NASCAR Winston Cup Series driver. Wikipedia

Billy Bigley.label: Billy Bigley
Billy Bigley.description:
Billy Bigley, Jr. is an American racing driver from Naples, Florida who competed in the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series.
Bigley competed in the entire 2001 NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series schedule for Spears Motorsports. Wikipedia

Bob Burcham.label: Bob Burcham
Bob Burcham.description: Robert Wayne "Bob" Burcham, Sr. was a NASCAR Winston Cup Series driver whose career spanned from 1968 to 1979. His primary ride was the #19 Belden Asphalt-sponsored Chevrolet of Mr. Henley Gray. Jack White was Burcham's other employer in NASCAR. Wikipedia

Bob Derrington.label: Bob Derrington
Bob Derrington.description: Bob Derrington is a retired NASCAR Grand National Series race car driver whose career spanned from 1964 to 1966. Wikipedia

Bud Harless.label: Bud Harless
Bud Harless.description: Bud Harless was a NASCAR Grand National Series driver. Wikipedia
Bud Harless.Born: January 24, 1924, Gilbert, West Virginia, United States

Butch Hartman (racing driver).label: Butch Hartman
Butch Hartman (racing driver).description: Larry "Butch" Hartman was an American stock car racing national champion in the United States Automobile Club from Zanesville, Ohio. Wikipedia

Charlie Blanton.label: Charlie Blanton
Charlie Blanton.description: Charlie Blanton is a retired NASCAR Winston Cup Series race car driver who raced from 1973 to 1978. Wikipedia
Charlie Blanton.Born: December 29, 1935 (age 78), Gaffney, South Carolina, United States

Clifford Allison.label: Clifford Allison
Clifford Allison.description: Clifford Allison was an American stock car racing driver. Son of NASCAR champion Bobby Allison, he was a member of the "Alabama Gang". Wikipedia

Dakoda Armstrong.label: Dakoda Armstrong
Dakoda Armstrong.description: Dakoda Armstrong is an American stock car racing driver. A competitor in the NASCAR Nationwide Series, he drives the No. 43 WinField Ford for Richard Petty Motorsports. Wikipedia
Dakoda Armstrong.Born: July 16, 1991 (age 22), New Castle, Indiana, United States

David Simko.label: David Simko
David Simko.description: David Simko is a former NASCAR Winston Cup Series driver who participated in ten races over the course of six seasons. Wikipedia

Don Waterman.label: Don Waterman
Don Waterman.description: Don Waterman is a retired NASCAR Winston Cup Series race car driver whose career spanned from 1980 to 1983. Wikipedia

Eddie Sharp.label: Eddie Sharp
Eddie Sharp.description: Eddie Sharp, Jr. is an American stock car racing team owner and former driver, who formerly competed in the USAR Hooters Pro Cup Series and the NASCAR Busch Series He is a co-owner of Sharp Gallaher ... Wikipedia

Fain Skinner.label: Fain Skinner
Fain Skinner.description: Fain Skinner is an American stock car racing driver. Winner of the 1999 World Karting Association National Championship, he races part-time in the NASCAR Nationwide Series and the ARCA Racing Series. Wikipedia
Fain Skinner.Born: February 21, 1985 (age 29), Live Oak, Florida, United States

Gary Balough.label: Gary Balough
Gary Balough.description: Gary Balough is a retired NASCAR Winston Cup Series driver who has competed from 1979 to 1992. Wikipedia
Gary Balough.Born: September 16, 1947 (age 66), Fort Lauderdale, Florida, United States

Scott Speed.label: Scott Speed
Scott Speed.description: Scott Andrew Speed is an American race car driver. Formerly a driver for the Scuderia Toro Rosso F1 team, he made his Formula One race debut at the 2006 Bahrain Grand Prix; becoming the first American to race in F1 since Michael Andretti in 1993. Wikipedia
